intro: Sagenia varia, commonly known as the variable sage, is a perennial herb native to arid and semi-arid regions of southern Africa. It belongs to the Lamiaceae family, which is characterized by square stems and aromatic leaves. The plant typically grows to a height of 30–60 cm, with opposite, lance-shaped leaves that are often hairy. Its small, tubular flowers are usually pink or purple, arranged in whorls along the stem. Sagenia varia is well adapted to drought conditions, making it a resilient plant in its native habitat.
